H0.text: Shingles is a disease caused by the same virus that causes chickenpox.

H1.text: Gout is a disease caused by the same virus that causes chickenpox.

H2.text: Diabetes is a disease caused by the same virus that causes chickenpox.

H3.text: Hepatitis is a disease caused by the same virus that causes chicken pox.

A4.text: Shingles is caused by the varicella zoster virus (VZV) that also causes chickenpox.

A5.text: Besides the skin, other organs, such as the liver or brain, may also be affected (causing hepatitis or encephalitis, respectively).

A6.text: Exposure to the varicella virus found in shingles blisters can cause chickenpox in someone who has not yet had chickenpox.

A7.text: Risk factors for reactivation of the dormant virus include old age, poor immune function, and having contracted chickenpox before 18 months of age.
